title: Petition to ban all Bronze, Silver and Gold players from Gameplay & Balance.
body:
The quality of discussion in this forum is  low and that is because of the infestation of low elo players cluttering discussion. A low elo player has no right or reason to talk about balance because they don't understand the game. 

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/wY7wJZ9h-need-5-people-and-3-ignites-to-kill-heimer

 To put it simply If a person fails at the game they simply do not have anything meaningful the contribute to a discussion about said game. 

This is a petition to ban all low elo players from this board so productive and insightful discussions can take place without their deleterious input. 

Thanks, +1 to endorse the petition.

> EDIT: There is a reason why Hashinshin, Irelia carries U, Dyrus and other LCS players post on reddit and avoid this board like the plague.  The atmosphere here is hostile to anyone who actually knows what they are talking about .

> Once we remove the low-elos quality posters will return-

A person can know very little about how a gun works and be an incredible marksman. Conversely, another person can be a horrible shot, but know how to disassemble two guns, then reassemble them using each others' parts and have them both functioning within minutes. One has the application of skill, while the other has the application of knowledge; both would probably have intelligent insights on the design of guns. One will think more with their hands, and the other will think more in their head/on paper, and if they *listen* to each other, they'll both learn something.

Moral of the analogy; skill =/= knowledge, and both sides can benefit from discussion. **Restricting G&B to one half of the group would kill most intelligent discussion.**

I could keep using analogies, applying your logic to a lot of things, just to show how that logic fails, but you didn't get it the first time.
> any high elo player can tell you league of legends is not a mechanics based game, its a decision making game.

*Any MOBA veteran* can tell you that learning the mechanics is the tutorial, and making choices is how one handles PvP. Actually, that applies to *any* game, period. So the only people who wouldn't understand this are people who haven't been playing games for any significant amount of time.
> How much you understand the game directly translates to how good at it you are.

It directly *affects* how you make decisions. The more you know, the better decisions you will make. There is some mechanical learning to it; some players don't have 200/ms reflexes or perfect mouse control.

You claim "The quality of discussion in this forum is low and that is because of the infestation of low elo players cluttering discussion. A low elo player has no right or reason to talk about balance because they don't understand the game." Please show me evidence that substantiates this claim, otherwise, you "[have] no right or reason to talk about" this subject. Furthermore, you are basically advocating that kids should all be considered stupid because the majority aren't capable of holding an intelligent debate. Sure kids (like me) are generally not intelligent, but we see things differently than adults. For example, there is a simple sleight of hand trick where the performer pretends to pass an object from one hand to the other, but the object is always in the same hand. This commonly fools adults, but as James Randi explained: Kids are often not fooled because they don't have enough experience to automatically assume the object was passed to the other hand.
